image.altText: A woman in a yellow vest passes a piece of paper to a woman wearing a cream jumper and red skirt.

props.synopsis: Canberrans will head to the polls on Saturday to choose the 11th Legislative Assembly. Here's everything you need to know about where to vote, what time the polls close, how to fill in ballot papers and when we're likely to know results.Â

title.children: Here's what you need to know about voting in the ACT election

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The court found the man's BMW convertible was "substantially over-insured" for more than $130,000, when he'd purchased it for $25,000 a year before the incident.

title.children: Driver jailed after staging car crash as part of $130,000 insurance fraud attempt

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

props.synopsis: The ACT Bar Council dismisses 10 complaints made about former ACT director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold during his prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Complaints about the conduct of former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold during Bruce Lehrmann trial dismissed

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White will face a jury trial in November after he pleaded not guilty over the death of the great-grandmother who was tasered in a Snowy Mountains nursing home in 2023.

title.children: NSW police officer to face jury trial over taser death of 95yo old Clare Nowland

image.altText: A close up image of recycled cardboard

props.synopsis: Plans to build what would be Australia's largest plastics recycling plant in the NSW Southern Highlands have advanced despite community opposition and environmental concerns.

title.children: Residents outraged by proposal to put Australia's largest recycling plant 200 metres from their homes

image.altText: A historic photo of a house on wheels.

props.synopsis: The nation-building Snowy Hydro scheme came at a huge cost for the people of Old Adaminaby, some of whom are still lamenting their loss more than 65 years later.

title.children: Decades after the government destroyed their town, residents grapple with progress and bitterness

image.altText: A figure in high vis orange shirt and hat kneels to pick blueberries with a bucket of berries between their legs.

props.synopsis: The inquiry was a key recommendation from the NSW Anti-Slavery Commissioner, who identified practices including forced labour, possible sexual servitude and emerging labour trafficking.

title.children: Modern slavery claims to be examined amid 'substantial evidence' of migrant workers being exploited in NSW

image.altText: A woman is hugging a golden retriever dog

props.synopsis: Deciding when to end the life of an old or sick pet can be incredibly tough, so many animal owners are now seeking help from bereavement counsellors.Â

title.children: How do you make the heartbreaking decision to say goodbye to a pet?

image.altText: Andrew Barr wearing a dark grey jacket filling out a form in a polling booth.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 â stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A man wearing a green jacket and hat holding tomatoes.

props.synopsis:
Tomato growers placed into quarantine after the discovery of the tomato brown rugose virus say authorities should have been better prepared for the arrival of the virus.

Â 

Â 

Â 

Â

title.children: 'Devastated': Tens of millions of dollars in losses smash Australian tomato farmers

image.altText: A husband smiles at her wife who is smiling at the camera in front of some mountains

props.synopsis: Radio host, TV star and podcaster Hamish Blake on his secret fitness training, taking up golf, the 'barbs that stick in your heart' when raising children, and other parenting challenges.

title.children: 'A fight that's ultimately futile': Hamish Blake on facing his own mortality in his home gym

image.altText: A sign that says 24/7 banking with a Westpac logo next to it.

props.synopsis: Customers with Westpac and St George are reporting difficulties accessing their internet banking for the third day in a row. Whether you're a personal customer or a business and have been affected, we want to hear from you.

title.children: Westpac and St George customers report third day of difficulties accessing internet banking

image.altText: Kingsley Dixon sits on a hill of orange brown rubble, in front of a horizon of mined land.

props.synopsis:
In the world's only jarrah forests a US aluminium giant has been mining bauxite for 60 years. Scientists say the damage may be permanent.

Â

title.children: The world's only jarrah forests have been mined for 60 years. The damage may be permanent

image.altText: Close up of woman with brown hair tied back has gold framed glasses, with pale skin and brown eyes. She looks ahead solemnly.

props.synopsis: Tayla-Jane Jackson had a late-term abortion in 2023 with the agreement of two doctors. She does not want a private member's bill introduced by Liberal MLC Ben Hood to pass parliament.Â

title.children: 'I would not be able to cope': One of the few women in SA who needed a late-term abortion doesn't agree with changing the laws

image.altText: Shai Bolton prepares to dish off a handball

props.synopsis: Fremantle has reached an agreement with Richmond on the talented forward, while a number of stars face a nervous wait on the final day of the AFL trade period. Follow live.

title.children: Shai Bolton set to join Fremantle as star Bulldogs trio remain in limbo ahead of trade deadline

image.altText: A family looks out onto planes on the tarmac at an airport.

props.synopsis: Climate advocates have lodged a complaint with the consumer watchdog over Qantas' sustainability and climate claims.

title.children: For a few extra dollars, Qantas offers to 'offset' your flight. But does it really do anything for the climate?

image.altText: An older man poses on an armchair with one leg crossed over the other.

props.synopsis: George Negus's frosty interview with Maragaret Thatcher became famous, but it sparked a flurry of calls between Canberra and London and a demand by the then-British prime minister to have the full interview released without edits.

title.children: From high-school teacher to celebrated journalist. George Negus remembered for his most famous interview

image.altText: Albanese in a high-vis yellow vest speaks in front of a microphone in front of a green sign

props.synopsis: Household batteries could form part of a plan to make electricity cheaper for low- to middle-income earners before the next election.

title.children: Labor mulls 'electrify everything' pre-election household plan

image.altText: A graphic showing a kid sitting in the dark looking tired with a bright computer screen in their face.

props.synopsis: With parents worried about screen time and teachers dealing with AI-assisted plagiarism, some experts say it might be time for education to change.

title.children: 'I miss pen and paper': Students criticise being taught on computers as educators suggest rethinking bans

image.altText: Lisa Marie Presley at the Cartier Flagship Store for a special party to unveil the book "Cartier: Untamed".

props.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died before she had the chance to finish her memoir, From Here To The Great Unknown. Per her wishes, her eldest daughter Riley Keough helped it make its way into the world.

title.children: From Michael Jackson to Scientology: Here's what we learnt from Lisa Marie Presley's posthumous memoir

image.altText: Woman stands in bunch holding a bunch of documents

props.synopsis: Darwin woman Toni Grant was shocked when she received a call from a stranger telling her they'd found personal records containing her mobile number, tax file number and medical information in a pile of rubbish in bushland. Similar documents belonging to others were also found.

title.children: Toni's personal information was found dumped in the bush. She's been looking for answers ever since

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are lower after losses on Wall Street, where all three benchmarks fell. Mining stocks are in the red. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls amid oil price slump, Rio Tinto shares down after iron ore update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Westpac online banking  third day of disruptions
Construction and hospitality sectors top payment defaults

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a black spherical piece of debris.

props.synopsis: Mysterious black spheres washed up on Coogee Beach on Tuesday. The beach has been closed until further notice as Randwick City Council works to safely remove the debris and investigates.

title.children: Sydney's Coogee Beach shut after discovery of mysterious black balls

image.altText: Beryl Grant

props.synopsis: Survivors of forced adoption in WA say the Beryl Grant Community Centre should not carry the name of a key figure in the practice of separating unmarried mothers from their babies.

title.children: 'Considerable trauma': Matron's forced adoption legacy sparks calls to rename community centre

image.altText: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic shouts on the sideline during Australia's World Cup qualifier against Japan.

props.synopsis: The Socceroos arrived 45 minutes later than expected at Saitama Stadium for their World Cup qualifier against Japan, leaving them just 10 minutes to warm up on the pitch.

title.children: Socceroos credited for not letting late arrival phase them against Japan

image.altText: A monk with a shaved head sits in a saffron robe with bare arms folded.

props.synopsis: There are some shocking statistics around the violence and abuse children in Cambodia suffer, and a new program led by the country's venerated Buddhist monks is helping to drive change inside families.Â

title.children: More than half of Cambodian children are severely beaten. It's hoped monks could change that

image.altText: A white and blue coloured "Lufthansa" flight takes off with three other jets from the carrier seen on the tarmac below

props.synopsis: Lufthansa agrees to pay the US federal transport agency its largest-ever penalty issued against an airline for civil rights violations.

title.children: German flag carrier Lufthansa to pay record US penalty over mistreatment of 128 Jewish passengers

image.altText: A large, white coral-like creature is swaying in the water.

props.synopsis: On the bottom of the Pacific Ocean, near fissures spewing hot water, a submersible stumbled upon a thriving community of animals living in cavities below.

title.children: Scientists cracked open the sea floor. They did not expect to find live worms and snails

image.altText: Counsel assisting the commissioner, Philip Urquhart

props.synopsis: The coroner probing WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention tells the Justice Department it looks like it "doesn't want an exploration" of evidence about the demographics of young people sent to the notorious Unit 18.

title.children: Coroner expresses concerns about Justice Department's understanding of law, weighs up calling ministers

image.altText: A graphic hows two men shaking hands with blue shining behind him and red shining behind the other man.

props.synopsis: The LNP leader and Queensland premier will put questions to each other in the second debate of the election campaign.

title.children: David Crisafulli and Steven Miles to face off in second leaders debate two weeks out from election

image.altText: Kylian MbappÃ© stands on the pitch in a Real Madrid jersey with his lips pursed.

props.synopsis: Representatives for Kylian MbappÃ© say claims in Swedish media that the French football star is the subject of a rape investigation are "false and irresponsible".

title.children: Kylian MbappÃ© denies rape allegations aired in Swedish media

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the estranged wife of ex-AFL star Ricky Olarenshaw claims his client is the victim of dodgy police work, exploitation, and threats by another Australian man to bring in "very powerful people."Â

title.children: Allegations of threats and wads of cash emerge in case of Bali sex parlour with alleged links to ex-AFL star

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Foreign Minister said she didn't believe "we gain anything by shouting each other down" after being forced to stop her speech multiple times.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protesters shout down Penny Wong as she delivers speech in Tasmania

image.altText: A bald man with glasses smiles against a yellow backdrop. He's holding a claymation figurine in front of him on a wooden wheel.

props.synopsis: Adam Elliot talks through his first feature film in 15 years, and his careful trademark balance of tragedy, comedy and clay.

title.children: Australia's claymation genius is back, with an ultra-dark comedy inspired by his parents' hoarding
